title: Biden officials threaten to sue Texas over floating border barriers
description: The Department of Justice plans to sue Texas over Gov. Greg Abbott’s border practices.

title: Amsterdam votes to ban cruise ships
description: A political party in Amsterdam cited pollution and crowding as reasons for relocating a cruise terminal away from the city, effectively banning cruises.

title: Russia comes under global criticism for grain deal pullout, port attacks
description: The grain initiative was broadly popular — including among some countries that have maintained friendly ties with Russia since its invasion.

title: Biden elevates CIA director Burns to Cabinet member
description: President Biden will make CIA director Bill Burns a Cabinet member, reflecting the central role the spy chief has played in the administration’s foreign policy.

title: Russia arrests Igor Girkin, ex-security officer who led operations in Ukraine
description: Accused of killings in Donbas and convicted by a Dutch court of murder in the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, the ex-FSB colonel was arrested in Russia only after criticizing Vladimir Putin.

title: She’s the front-runner in the race to oust Maduro. He’s out to block her.
description: María Corina Machado is out to defeat Venezuela's president despite the roadblocks.

title: Netanyahu defiant as vote to limit Israel courts looms amid rising protests
description: Demonstrators rushed back into the streets following a defiant televised address in which Netanyahu blasted opponents for their “absurd” scare tactics.

title: Skull fragments believed to be Beethoven’s sent from U.S. to Vienna for study
description: A U.S. businessman, Paul Kaufmann, has handed over inherited skull fragments presumed to belong to the composer Beethoven, for medical study in Vienna.

title: Years after a border separation, a family’s reunion was in a judge’s hands
description: The Biden administration brought Magdalena Hernández Pérez back to the United States, but then came the shock: A foster care agency now had custody of Mildred.

title: Asian filmmakers watch Hollywood strikes with hope and frustration
description: South Korea's "Squid Game" and India's "RRR" made millions for Netflix. But local actors, writers and crew don't have the protections U.S. workers are fighting for.

title: A Taylor Swift drag queen rises in the Philippines
description: In one of the most Swift-crazy countries in the world, Taylor Sheesh has become an unlikely, unstoppable star.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv using U.S.-provided cluster munitions; Odessa strikes raise tensions after grain deal ends
description: National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said Thursday that the controversial munitions are making “an impact on Russia’s defensive formations."

title: A far-right European Union could be around the corner
description: That Spain could see a far-right party wield power after Sunday’s election marks only the latest chapter in a larger European story of far-right parties entering into the mainstream.
